humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the size of the resected breast tissue as 9 x 7 x 4 cm. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, which in this case is 9 cm (the largest dimension given). Based on the rules provided, T1 tumors are 2 cm or less, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm, and T3 tumors are more than 5 cm. Since the largest tumor size is more than 5 cm, it cannot be T1 or T2. However, since there is no indication of direct extension to the chest wall or skin, it is not a T4 tumor. Therefore, the T stage for this report is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, it is mentioned that the size of the breast specimen is 9 x 7 x 4 cm. The largest diameter of the tumor is 9 cm. According to the TNM staging system for cancer, T2 stage is assigned when the tumor size is more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Hence, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
